Pre-Game Insights: Ghana is seeking to rebound from a recent slump, while Mali is the bookmakers' favourite to top Group I of the 2026 World Cup qualifiers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mali is second in Group I of the 2026 World Cup qualifiers, having amassed four points from their opening two matches against Chad and the Central African Republic.
Ghana's squad includes two new players, Ibrahim Sulemana and Brandon Thomas-Asante, who hope to make their debuts and contribute to a victory for Ghana.
Others: The Black Stars of Ghana are fourth in Group I, with three points from their opening two matches.
Mali will miss Tottenham midfielder Yves Bissouma, who is still recovering from an injury sustained during the season.
